result.execSummary:
The defendant Arthur A Armstrong was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
DE will complete an AODA assessment and any follow up treatment recommended

DE will maintain absolute sobriety

Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. 

No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

No contact with Marie Bentley without prior approval from DOC Agent.

DE will pay court costs, provide DNA/pay surcharge.

DE will have 29 days credit if revoked.

2022GF41 consolidated into 2022CF52.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Case settlement

1:09 PM Defendant Arthur A Armstrong in court.  Attorney Renee M Taber in court for Arthur A Armstrong.  Attorney Emily Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls the case. 

Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE advised of Constitutional Rights, Factual basis/ PC found, plea freely, knowingly, voluntarily, intelligently made, court accepts plea G, finds DE guilty. 

DE will enter a plea to amended Ct 1 in 21CF209 and to Ct 2 in 22CF52, enhancers dismissed.   Recommended sentence will be for Imposed/Stayed sentence of 1 year jail, DE will be placed on 3 yrs probation.  DE will complete an AODA assessment and any follow up treatment recommended, maintain absolute sobriety,  no contact with Marie Bentley without agents prior approval, pay court costs, provide DNA sample/pay surcharge.
